title: Modeling a Periodic Context - Robotic Arm

content.question: Part A The graph of <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and its dashed midline for two full cycles is shown. Five points, <math> <mi>F</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>G</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>J</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>K</mi> </math>, and <math> <mi>P</mi> </math>, are labeled on the graph. No scale is indicated, and no axes are presented. Determine possible coordinates <math> <mfenced> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mi>h</mi> <mfenced> <mi>t</mi> </mfenced> </mrow> </mfenced> </math> for the five points: <math> <mi>F</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>G</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>J</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>K</mi> </math>, and <math> <mi>P</mi> </math>. Moving from left to right: Point F is at a maximum point. Point G is on the midline. Point J is at a minimum point. Point K is on the midline. Point P is at a maximum point.

frqParts.text: Part A The graph of <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and its dashed midline for two full cycles is shown. Five points, <math> <mi>F</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>G</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>J</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>K</mi> </math>, and <math> <mi>P</mi> </math>, are labeled on the graph. No scale is indicated, and no axes are presented. Determine possible coordinates <math> <mfenced> <mrow> <mi>t</mi> <mo>,</mo> <mi>h</mi> <mfenced> <mi>t</mi> </mfenced> </mrow> </mfenced> </math> for the five points: <math> <mi>F</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>G</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>J</mi> </math>, <math> <mi>K</mi> </math>, and <math> <mi>P</mi> </math>. Moving from left to right: Point F is at a maximum point. Point G is on the midline. Point J is at a minimum point. Point K is on the midline. Point P is at a maximum point.

Part B The function <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> can be written in the form <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mi>h</mi><mtext> </mtext><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>=</mo><mi>a</mi><mi>cos</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>b</mi><mo stretchy="false">(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mi>c</mi><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo stretchy="false">)</mo><mo>+</mo><mi>d</mi> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@494E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. Find values of constants <math> <semantics> <mi>a</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyyaaaa@387E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mi>b</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyyaaaa@387E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, <math> <semantics> <mi>c</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyyaaaa@387E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and <math> <semantics> <mi>d</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamyyaaaa@387E@</annotation> </semantics> </math>.

Part C Refer to the graph of <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> in part (A). The <math> <semantics> <mi>t</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math>-coordinate of <math> <semantics> <mi>K</mi> <annotation </semantics> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiDamaaBaaaleaacaaIXaaabeaaaaa@3978@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, and the <math> <semantics> <mi>t</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math>-coordinate of <math> <mi>P</mi> </math> is <math> <semantics> <mrow> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiDamaaBaaaleaacaaIXaaabeaaaaa@3978@</annotation> </semantics> </math>. (i) On the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo><msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo><msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D76@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, which of the following is true about <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math>? <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is positive and increasing. <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is positive and decreasing. <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is negative and increasing. <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is negative and decreasing. (ii) On the interval <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mo stretchy="false">(</mo> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>1</mn> </msub> <mo>,</mo> <msub> <mi>t</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msub> <mo stretchy="false">)</mo> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@3D76@</annotation> </semantics> </math>, describe the concavity of the graph of <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> and determine whether the rate of change of <math> <semantics> <mi>h</mi> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@+=feaagCart1ev2aqatCvAUfeBSjuyZL2yd9gzLbvyNv2CaerbnLMBP9MBGaLCVbqedmvETj2BSbqefm0B1jxALjhiov2DaebbnrfifHhDYfgasaacHOWxh9Jrpfey0dXdbba9q8qiW7rqarpfpeea0xe9Lq=Jc9vspeea0xc9Wrpe0=vr0=iq0xXdbba9pGe9FHe9aspf0xe9Fve9Fve9qapdbaqaaeGaciGaaiaabeqaamaabaabaaGcbaGaamiAaaaa@3885@</annotation> </semantics> </math> is increasing or decreasing.

skill.text: Skill 1.C: Construct new functions, using transformations, compositions, inverses, or regressions, that may be useful in modeling contexts, criteria, or data, with and without technology.
